translations.text: Alif. Lam. Mim.
The Romans have been defeated
in the neighbouring land;<sup foot_note="180166">1</sup> but after their defeat they shall gain victory in a few years.
All power belongs to Allah both before and after.<sup foot_note="180104">1</sup> On that day will the believers rejoice
at the victory granted by Allah.<sup foot_note="180167">1</sup> He grants victory to whomsoever He pleases. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Compassionate.
This is Allah's promise and He does not go back on His promise. But most people do not know.
People simply know the outward aspect of the worldly life but are utterly heedless<sup foot_note="180168">1</sup> of the Hereafter.

Do they not reflect on themselves?<sup foot_note="180169">1</sup> Allah created the heavens and the earth and whatever lies between them in Truth and for an appointed term.<sup foot_note="180170">2</sup> Yet many people deny that they will meet their Lord.<sup foot_note="180171">3</sup>

Have they not travelled through the earth that they may observe what was the end of their predecessors<sup foot_note="180172">1</sup> who were far mightier and tilled the land<sup foot_note="180173">2</sup> and built upon it more than these have ever built?<sup foot_note="180174">3</sup> And Allah's Messengers came to them with Clear Signs.<sup foot_note="180175">4</sup> It was not Allah Who wronged them, but it is they who wronged themselves.<sup foot_note="180176">5</sup>
Evil was the end of those evil-doers, for they gave the lie to Allah's Signs and scoffed at them.
Allah creates in the first instance and will later repeat it.<sup foot_note="180177">1</sup> Thereafter it is to Him that you shall be sent back.
On that Day when the Hour will come to pass,<sup foot_note="180178">1</sup> the criminals shall be dumbfounded.<sup foot_note="180179">2</sup>

None whom they had associated with Allah in His Divinity will intercede on their behalf;<sup foot_note="180180">1</sup> rather, they will disown those whom they had set up as Allah's associates in His Divinity.<sup foot_note="180181">2</sup>
On that Day when the Hour will come to pass, people will be split into groups.<sup foot_note="180182">1</sup>
Then those who believed and acted righteously will be placed in a Garden<sup foot_note="180183">1</sup> and will be happy and jubilant.<sup foot_note="180184">2</sup>
As for those who disbelieved<sup foot_note="180185">1</sup> and gave the lie to Our Signs and to the encounter of the Hereafter, they will be arraigned for chastisement.
So<sup foot_note="180186">1</sup> glorify Allah<sup foot_note="180187">2</sup> in the evening and the morning.
His is all praise in the heavens and in the earth; (and glorify Him) in the afternoon and when the sun begins to decline.<sup foot_note="180188">1</sup>

He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and revives the earth after it is dead.<sup foot_note="180189">1</sup> Likewise will you be raised to life (after you die).
And of His<sup foot_note="180190">1</sup> Signs is that He created you from dust and behold, you became human beings, and are multiplying around (the earth).<sup foot_note="180191">2</sup>

And of His Signs is that He has created mates for you from your own kind<sup foot_note="180192">1</sup> that you may find peace in them<sup foot_note="180193">2</sup> and He has set between you love and mercy.<sup foot_note="180194">3</sup> Surely there are Signs in this for those who reflect.

And of His Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth<sup foot_note="180195">1</sup> and the diversity of your tongues and colours.<sup foot_note="180196">2</sup> Indeed there are Signs in this for the wise.
And of His Signs is your sleeping at night and your seeking His Bounty<sup foot_note="180197">1</sup> during the day. Indeed there are Signs in this for those who hearken.

And of His Signs is that He shows you lightning, arousing both fear and hope,<sup foot_note="180198">1</sup> and sends down water from the sky and revives the earth after it is dead.<sup foot_note="180199">2</sup> Indeed there are Signs in this for those who use their reason.

And of His Signs is that the sky and the earth stand firm by His command.<sup foot_note="180200">1</sup> Then no sooner than He summons you out of the earth you will come forth.<sup foot_note="180201">2</sup>
To Him belong all who are in the heavens and all who are on the earth. All are in obedience to Him.

It is He Who creates in the first instance and it is He Who will repeat the creation, and that is easier for Him.<sup foot_note="180202">1</sup> His is the loftiest attribute in the heavens and the earth. He is the Most Mighty, the Most Wise.

He sets forth<sup foot_note="180204">1</sup> for you a parable from your own lives. Do you have among your slaves some who share with you the sustenance that We have bestowed on you so that you become equals in it, all being alike, and then you would hold them in fear as you fear each other?<sup foot_note="180205">2</sup> Thus do We make plain the Signs for those who use reason.
But the wrong-doers follow their desires without any knowledge. Who, then, can show the way to him whom Allah lets go astray?<sup foot_note="180206">1</sup> Such shall have no helpers.

(O Prophet and his followers),<sup foot_note="180207">1</sup> turn your face singlemindedly<sup foot_note="180208">2</sup> to the true Faith<sup foot_note="180209">3</sup> and adhere to the true nature on which Allah has created human beings.<sup foot_note="180210">4</sup> The mould fashioned by Allah cannot be altered.<sup foot_note="180211">5</sup> That is the True, Straight Faith,<sup foot_note="180212">6</sup> although most people do not know.

(Adhere to the True Faith and) turn to Him,<sup foot_note="180213">1</sup> and hold Him in awe,<sup foot_note="180214">2</sup> and establish Prayer,<sup foot_note="180215">3</sup> and do not be of those who associate others with Allah in His Divinity,
those who have split up their religion and have become divided into sects, each party exulting in what they have.<sup foot_note="180216">1</sup>

(Such are human beings) that when any misfortune befalls them, they cry to their Lord, penitently turning to Him.<sup foot_note="180217">1</sup> But no sooner that He lets them have a taste of His Mercy than some of them begin associating others with their Lord in His Divinity<sup foot_note="180218">2</sup>
so that they may show ingratitude to Us for the favours We had bestowed upon them. So, enjoy yourselves a while; but then you shall soon come to know.
Have We sent down any sanction which provides support to their associating others with Allah in His Divinity?<sup foot_note="180219">1</sup>
When We make people have a taste of Our Mercy, they exult in it; and when any misfortune befalls them in consequence of their deeds, then lo and behold, they despair.<sup foot_note="180220">1</sup>
Do they not see that Allah enlarges and straitens the sustenance of those whom He pleases? There are Signs in this for those who believe.<sup foot_note="180221">1</sup>

So give his due to the near of kin, and to the needy, and to the wayfarer.<sup foot_note="180222">1</sup> That is better for those who desire to please Allah. It is they who will prosper.<sup foot_note="180223">2</sup>

Whatever you pay as interest so that it may increase the wealth of people does not increase in the sight of Allah.<sup foot_note="180224">1</sup> As for the Zakah that you give, seeking with it Allah's good pleasure, that is multiplied manifold.<sup foot_note="180225">2</sup>

It is Allah<sup foot_note="180226">1</sup> Who created you, then bestowed upon you your sustenance,<sup foot_note="180227">2</sup> and He will cause you to die and then will bring you back to life. Can any of those whom you associate with Allah in His Divinity! do any such thing?<sup foot_note="180228">3</sup> Glory be to Him and exalted be He above whatever they associate with Allah in His Divinity.

Evil has become rife on the land and at sea because of men's deeds; this in order that He may cause them to have a taste of some of their deeds; perhaps they will turn back (from evil).<sup foot_note="180229">1</sup>
(O Prophet), say: “Traverse in the earth and see what was the end of those who went before you: most of them associated others with Allah in His Divinity.”<sup foot_note="180230">1</sup>
So turn your face exclusively towards the True Faith before there comes the Day whose coming from Allah cannot be averted,<sup foot_note="180231">1</sup> the Day when people will split into groups.
He who disbelieves will suffer the consequence of it<sup foot_note="180232">1</sup> and he who acts righteously, they will pave the way for their own good
so that Allah may, out of His Bounty, reward those who believe and act righteously. Verily He does not love the unbelievers.

And of His Signs is that He sends winds to herald good tidings<sup foot_note="180233">1</sup> and that He may give you a taste of His Mercy, and that ships may sail at His bidding,<sup foot_note="180234">2</sup> and you may seek His Bounty<sup foot_note="180235">3</sup> and give thanks to Him.

We sent Messengers before you to their respective nations, and they brought Clear Signs<sup foot_note="180236">1</sup> to them. Then We took vengeance upon those who acted wickedly.<sup foot_note="180237">2</sup> It was incumbent on Us to come to the aid of the believers.

Allah sends the winds that stir up clouds and then He spreads them in the sky as He pleases and splits them into different fragments, whereafter you see drops of rain pouring down from them. He then causes the rain to fall on whomsoever of His servants He pleases, and lo, they rejoice at it,
although before that they were given to despair.
See, then, the tokens of Allah's Mercy: how He revives the earth after it is dead.<sup foot_note="180203">1</sup> Verily He is the One Who will revive the dead. He has power over everything.
But if We were to send a wind and then their tilth has become yellow,<sup foot_note="180238">1</sup> they would never cease to disbelieve.<sup foot_note="180239">2</sup>
(O Prophet), you cannot make the dead hear,<sup foot_note="180240">1</sup> nor can you make the deaf hear your call when they turn back in retreat,<sup foot_note="180241">2</sup>
nor can you guide the blind out of their error.<sup foot_note="180242">1</sup> You can make none hear (your call) except those who believe in Our Signs and have surrendered themselves (to Him).

It is Allah Who created you in a state of weakness; then after weakness He gave you strength, then after strength He made you weak and old. He creates what He pleases.<sup foot_note="180243">1</sup> He is All-Knowing, All-Powerful.

On that Day when the Hour will come to pass<sup foot_note="180244">1</sup> the wicked shall swear that they had stayed (in the world) no more than an hour.<sup foot_note="180245">2</sup> Thus they used to be deceived in the life of the world.<sup foot_note="180246">3</sup>

But those who had been endowed with knowledge and faith shall say: “According to Allah's Record you have stayed till the Day of Resurrection. Now, this is the Day of Resurrection. But you did not know.”
So that will be the Day when the excuses of the wrong-doers will not avail them, nor will they be asked to make amends.<sup foot_note="180247">1</sup>
In the Qur'an We have explained things to people in myriad ways. But no matter what Sign you bring to them, those who are resolved upon denying the Truth will say: “You are given to falsehood.”
Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who have no knowledge.
Therefore, (O Prophet), have patience. Surely Allah's promise is true.<sup foot_note="180248">1</sup> Let those who lack certainty not cause you to be unsteady.<sup foot_note="180249">2</sup>
